DOCNAME: CASE OF VEREINIGUNG DEMOKRATISCHER SOLDATEN ÖSTERREICHS AND GUBI v. AUSTRIA
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 10;Violation of Art. 13 (first applicant);No violation of Art. 13 (second applicant);Not necessary to examine Art. 14+10;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - finding of violation sufficient;Costs and expenses partial award - domestic proceedings;Costs and expenses partial award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . ORG The first applicant , a GPE - based association , published a DATE magazine aimed at the soldiers serving in the NORP army and entitled der Igel ( " The Hedgehog " ) . It contained information and articles - often of a critical nature - on military life .

CARDINAL . ORG On DATE the association requested the Federal Minister for Defence ( PERSON für GPE ) to have der PERSON distributed in the barracks in the same way as the only other CARDINAL military magazines published by private associations , ORG and PERSON . The army had adopted the practice of sending these magazines out , alternately and at its own expense , with the official information bulletin distributed to all conscripts ( ORG ) .

The minister did not reply to this request . When questioned by members of parliament , he stated in a letter of CARDINAL DATE that he would not authorise the distribution of PERSON in barracks . In his view , section CARDINAL para . CARDINAL of LAW ( PERSON , see paragraph CARDINAL below ) conferred on all armed forces personnel the right to receive without any restriction , through sources accessible to the public , information on political events . However , on military LOC the only publications that could be supplied were those which identified at least to some extent with the constitutional duties of the army , did not damage its reputation and did not lend column space to political parties . Even critical magazines such as the journal LOC of the trade union youth organisation would not be banned if they respected these conditions . PERSON , on the other hand , did not comply with them . The minister derived authority for his decision in this matter from LAW ( Bundesverfassungsgesetz ) and sections CARDINAL para . CARDINAL and CARDINAL of LAW , LAW ) and LAW para . CARDINAL of ORG ( Allgemeine Dienstvorschriften für das PERSON , see paragraphs CARDINAL below ) .

CARDINAL . ORG The second applicant , a member of the VDSÖ , began his national service on DATE at the LOC barracks in GPE . On DATE , on the occasion of his taking the oath , he made a protest directed against the President of the Republic . Over DATE , he lodged several complaints , published with CARDINAL of his fellow conscripts an open letter criticising the number of fatigue duties to which he was assigned and circulated a petition in support of a conscientious objector .
On CARDINAL , CARDINAL and DATE he was personally informed of the content of the military law applicable to his situation .
CARDINAL . ORG On DATE , while distributing issue no . CARDINAL of der Igel in the barracks , he was ordered by an officer to cease .

In its editorial , the issue in question mentioned , as being one of the aims of the ORG , co - operation between conscripts and the cadres on the basis of their joint interests and of mutual respect . Some articles adopted a critical stance ; they dealt with , among other things , military training , the proceedings resulting from a complaint lodged by PERSON and the principles governing national service . The other articles discussed various contributions that had appeared in the press , the congress of the trade union youth movement , the aims and the activities of the ORG and the complaint of a conscript whose pay had been reduced following alleged loss of equipment .

CARDINAL . ORG On DATE another officer informed Mr Gubi of the content of the circulars of DATE and DATE and of the regulations of the PERSON barracks , as amended on DATE , which prohibited any distribution or despatching within the barracks of publications without the authorisation of the commanding officer ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) .
CARDINAL . ORG On DATE Mr PERSON complained about this ban and about the order of CARDINAL DATE ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) to ORG ( Beschwerdekommission in militärischen ORG ) at ORG .

On DATE ORG ( ORG ) at the ministry rejected the applicant ’s complaint , in accordance with ORG recommendation . In its view , the contested order was validly based on a DATE circular of ORG ( ORG ) , containing instructions regarding the distribution of printed matter , which were themselves based on LAW ( NORP über die allgemeinen Rechte der Staatsbürger ) , LAW of ORG and LAW ( see paragraphs CARDINAL and CARDINAL below ) . The first of those provisions affords the same protection to the property of public - law legal persons as that guaranteed to the property of private individuals ; accordingly , the PERSON barracks were to be regarded as the property of ORG , whose rights were exercised by the commanding officer .

The freedom of expression secured under LAW was subject to " statutory limits " ( gesetzliche GPE ) such as those which stemmed from the duty of discretion and obedience laid down in sections CARDINAL and CARDINAL of LAW and derived from the very nature of this special relationship of subordination ( besonderes PERSON ) . The contested measures had therefore in no way interfered with the freedom in question .
CARDINAL . Mr Gubi then applied to ORG ) . On DATE it declined to entertain his appeal on the ground that it did not raise genuine constitutional issues and had insufficient prospects of success .

CARDINAL . ORG DATE , however , ORG quashed the decision of CARDINAL DATE whereby the commanding officer of battalion no . CARDINAL had confirmed the CARDINAL days’ custody imposed on the applicant as a disciplinary penalty for having distributed der ORG in the barracks . It found that the provisions which Mr PERSON was accused of infringing , the DATE and DATE circulars ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) , were not binding on him but on the military authorities . This was not the case in regard to the relevant provisions of the Schwarzenberg barracks regulations , but these rules had been introduced on DATE and were therefore not yet in force at the material time .
CARDINAL . LAW DATE on the general rights of citizens protects property .
CARDINAL . ORG Article CARDINAL provides as follows :

" Subject to statutory limits , everyone has the right to express freely his opinion orally , in writing , in the printed word or through graphic expression . The Press may not be censored or restricted by a system of licences ... "
CARDINAL . ORG Article CARDINAL of LAW describes the general duties of the NORP armed forces .

CARDINAL . ORG At the material time the rights and obligations of military personnel were governed by sections DATE LAW . According to this statute , soldiers are under a duty to support the army in the performance of its tasks and to refrain from doing anything which could damage its reputation ( section CARDINAL para . CARDINAL ) . They have the right to submit requests and complaints and to file appeals ( section CARDINAL para . CARDINAL ) . They enjoy the same political rights as civilians ( section CARDINAL para . CARDINAL ) . However , the army must not be involved in any political activity and may not be used for political ends ( section CARDINAL para . CARDINAL ) . Consequently , such activities while on duty and on military LOC are prohibited , with the exception of those which consist in obtaining information as an individual on political events through sources accessible to the public ( section CARDINAL para . CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . The General Army Regulations , issued by ORG , set out the obligations attaching to national service . They provide , inter alia , that servicemen must always be ready to fulfil their duties in the best possible way and must refrain from doing anything which could damage the reputation of the army and undermine the confidence of the population in the defence of the country ( Regulation CARDINAL para . CARDINAL ) . Servicemen have a special relationship of subordination in regard to GPE . That relationship requires of them , in addition to the defence of the democratic institutions , discipline , comradeship , obedience , vigilance , courage and discretion ( Regulation CARDINAL para . CARDINAL ) . Under Regulation CARDINAL para . CARDINAL barracks’ commanders are bound to take all the measures necessary to maintain order and military security in the LOC in question ; to this end they are under a duty to issue rules ( PERSON ) governing inter alia access to the barracks ( Regulation CARDINAL para . CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . ORG By a circular of ORG of DATE the army general staff ( ORG ) instructed commanding officers to take preventive measures in respect of publications denigrating the army ( negatives wehrpolitisches PERSON ) . They were , among other things , to ban their distribution and posting up in military areas .

A circular from the general staff of ORG ) of CARDINAL DATE instructed the same officers to insert in the barracks rules a prohibition on the distribution or posting up without the commanding officer ’s authorisation of any non - official publication . The PERSON barracks rules were amended accordingly on DATE .
